cards.flavor: "In your misguided attempt to subvert the law, you have eloquently explained why the law must exist."
cards.name: Absorb
cards.text: Counter target spell. You gain 3 life.

cards.flavor:
"The absence of binocular vision imposes certain challenges for a flying creature, which are overcome via echolocation."
—Simic research notes
cards.name: Aeromunculus
cards.text:
Flying
{2}{G}{U}: Adapt 1. (If this creature has no +1/+1 counters on it, put a +1/+1 counter on it.)

cards.flavor:
"It's easy to get taken in by the spectacle, to enjoy a bit of naughty amusement. But make no mistake: the Cult of Rakdos is a danger."
—Tajic
cards.name: Bedevil
cards.text: Destroy target artifact, creature, or planeswalker.

cards.name: Emergency Powers
cards.text:
Each player shuffles their hand and graveyard into their library, then draws seven cards. Exile Emergency Powers.
Addendum - If you cast this spell during your main phase, you may put a permanent card with converted mana cost 7 or less from your hand onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Frenzied Arynx
cards.text:
Riot (This creature enters the battlefield with your choice of a +1/+1 counter or haste.)
Trample
{4}{R}{G}: Frenzied Arynx gets +3/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Gate Colossus
cards.text:
This spell costs {1} less to cast for each Gate you control.
Gate Colossus can't be blocked by creatures with power 2 or less.
Whenever a Gate enters the battlefield under your control, you may put Gate Colossus from your graveyard on top of your library.

cards.flavor: Cyclical and spiral patterns are the specialty of the Gyre Clade, which seeks to revitalize the cycles of nature.
cards.name: Growth Spiral
cards.text: Draw a card. You may put a land card from your hand onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor: She displays her scars with pride.
cards.name: Gruul Spellbreaker
cards.text:
Riot (This creature enters the battlefield with your choice of a +1/+1 counter or haste.)
Trample
As long as it's your turn, you and Gruul Spellbreaker have hexproof.

cards.flavor: The rights of ghosts are strictly protected under Orzhov bylaws, and those who enforce them can count on the ghosts' assistance.
cards.name: Imperious Oligarch
cards.text:
Vigilance
Afterlife 1 (When this creature dies, create a 1/1 white and black Spirit creature token with flying.)

cards.name: Incubation
cards.text: Look at the top five cards of your library. You may reveal a creature card from among them and put it into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order.

cards.name: Incongruity
cards.text: Exile target creature. That creature's controller creates a 3/3 green Frog Lizard creature token.

cards.flavor: "I told Jace that Ravnica would fall apart if he didn't take his responsibilities seriously. I didn't want to be right."
cards.name: Lavinia, Azorius Renegade
cards.text:
Each opponent can't cast noncreature spells with converted mana cost greater than the number of lands that player controls.
Whenever an opponent casts a spell, if no mana was spent to cast it, counter that spell.

cards.name: Light Up the Stage
cards.text:
Spectacle {R} (You may cast this spell for its spectacle cost rather than its mana cost if an opponent lost life this turn.)
Exile the top two cards of your library. Until the end of your next turn, you may play those cards.

cards.name: Mortify
cards.text: Destroy target creature or enchantment.

cards.name: Rafter Demon
cards.text:
Spectacle {3}{B}{R} (You may cast this spell for its spectacle cost rather than its mana cost if an opponent lost life this turn.)
When Rafter Demon enters the battlefield, if its spectacle cost was paid, each opponent discards a card.

cards.flavor: Ever wonder why you never see an old Rakdos Cultist?
cards.name: Rakdos Firewheeler
cards.text: When Rakdos Firewheeler enters the battlefield, it deals 2 damage to target opponent and 2 damage to up to one target creature or planeswalker.

cards.name: Rix Maadi Reveler
cards.text:
Spectacle {2}{B}{R} (You may cast this spell for its spectacle cost rather than its mana cost if an opponent lost life this turn.)
When Rix Maadi Reveler enters the battlefield, discard a card, then draw a card. If Rix Maadi Reveler's spectacle cost was paid, instead discard your hand, then draw three cards.

cards.name: Simic Ascendancy
cards.text:
{1}{G}{U}: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature you control.
Whenever one or more +1/+1 counters are put on a creature you control, put that many growth counters on Simic Ascendancy.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if Simic Ascendancy has twenty or more growth counters on it, you win the game.

cards.flavor: "Do not think me blind to your true mission...or your true master, Grand Arbiter."
cards.name: Sphinx's Insight
cards.text:
Draw two cards.
Addendum - If you cast this spell during your main phase, you gain 2 life.

cards.flavor: It drains vitality from those it touches.
cards.name: The Haunt of Hightower
cards.text:
Flying, lifelink
Whenever The Haunt of Hightower attacks, defending player discards a card.
Whenever a card is put into an opponent's graveyard from anywhere, put a +1/+1 counter on The Haunt of Hightower.

cards.name: Tithe Taker
cards.text:
During your turn, spells your opponents cast cost {1} more to cast and abilities your opponents activate cost {1} more to activate unless they're mana abilities.
Afterlife 1 (When this creature dies, create a 1/1 white and black Spirit creature token with flying.)

cards.name: Zegana, Utopian Speaker
cards.text:
When Zegana, Utopian Speaker enters the battlefield, if you control another creature with a +1/+1 counter on it, draw a card.
{4}{G}{U}: Adapt 4. (If this creature has no +1/+1 counters on it, put four +1/+1 counters on it.)
Each creature you control with a +1/+1 counter on it has trample.
